message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.DB 

This paper is likely to belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category as it deals with recommenders that personalize web content. It could also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category as it proposes a generic approach to link users/items based on their implicit consumption behavior. Additionally, it could be classified under Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) as it introduces a word embedding-based recommender. The paper also deals with handling incremental updates, which could make it relevant to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category. Finally, the paper could be relevant to the Databases (cs.DB) sub-category as it deals with linking users/items based on their consumption behavior.
